metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6912 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the gdImageWebPtr function in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.4 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via large width and height values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6912` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6').
